pr_title: Merge Stitch and Realm SDKs - 1: scaffolding

timeline.message: First iteration: added GMS library (possibly temporarily) to avoid introducing immediate breaking changes in how we process asynchronous operations with AsyncRealmTask. All original Stitch interfaces and proxies have been discarded in favour of Java classes (although this approach might be changed). Some interfaces connected to the collection's iterables have been omitted as it is unclear whether they will be needed or not for the time being.

timeline.bodyText: These types of javadoc should be removed as they don't make much sense in our API
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Historically we haven't used annotations like this. What value does it provide?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: I would say none, but maybe it did something in Stitch - haven't looked at it in detail though. I think it would be safe to delete.
replies.author: edualonso

replies.bodyText: Yeah, in that case I would probably just delete it.
replies.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: These should be removed
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText:
This annotation looks unfamiliar to me. I wonder if it is one used by a custom javadoc generator. In which case we need to replace it with @see and a proper link.
We should probably figure out exactly how this is used. Perhaps it is something we can utilize ourselves.
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: I have added a reminder for myself about this.

timeline.bodyText: All of these files should also have a Realm license header. You can copy one from any other class and just adjust the date to 2020
timeline.author: cmelchior
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,183 @@
+package io.realm.mongodb;

timeline.bodyText: Is this class being used anywhere?
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.message: Added licences to class headers plus a bit of cleanup
Added latest API methods and necessary classes
Added remote mongo client and remote database, their respective Os files and part of the native logic
Moved JNI callbacks outside RealmApp and added more remote collection classes
Updated object store branch to v10 and fixed wrong use of count call
Fixed wrong finalizer methods and cleanup to interop files

replies.bodyText: Also, I suspect the real parameter is a RealmUser that way you know which user is making requests. RealmApp.currentUser() might change.

replies.bodyText: I could create a public static builder and make the constructor private. It's not like it changes much, but it might make less tempting...?

replies.bodyText: With only one constructor keeping it as is probably fine 👍
